chat.content:
I will give you a Coq proof state, including both hypotheses and a specific goal and your need to prove it. Your response should be a singular code block of Coq proof starting with "```coq
", ending with "Qed.```", without any additional explanation or commentary. Follow to these guidelines:
Introduce variables using unique names to avoid any conflicts.
Keep each command distinct and separated, avoid concatenations like ';' or '[cmd|cmd]'.
Organize your proof with bullets like '-', '+', and '*' instead of braces ({, }). Shift to their double symbols like '--' and '++', when necessary.
Effectively use given premises, follow the syntax and structure demonstrated in the examples provided.

Example 1:

Hypotheses:
n, m: nat
IHn: m + n = n + m

Goal:
m + S n = S n + m

Proof:
```coq
simpl. rewrite <- IHn. auto.
Qed.```

Example 2:
Hypotheses:

Goal:
forall n m : nat, m + n = n + m

```coq
intros n m. induction n.
- simpl. auto.
- simpl. rewrite <- IHn. auto.
Qed.```

Solve This Proof State:

Hypotheses:
A: Set
A1: A
A0: A
eqA: A -> A -> Prop
plusA: A -> A -> A
invA: A -> A
multA: A -> A -> A
minusA: A -> A -> A
divA: A -> forall b : A, ~ eqA b A0 -> A
cs: CoefStructure A A0 A1 eqA plusA invA minusA multA divA
eqA_dec: forall a b : A, {eqA a b} + {~ eqA a b}
n: nat
ltM: mon n -> mon n -> Prop
ltM_dec: forall a b : mon n, {ltM a b} + {ltM b a} + {a = b}
os: OrderStructure (mon n) (zero_mon n) ltM (mult_mon n)

Goal:
forall (a b : Term A n) (nZb : ~ zeroP A0 eqA (n:=n) b) (p q : list (Term A n)), canonical A0 eqA ltM (pX (A:=A) (n:=n) a p) -> canonical A0 eqA ltM (pX (A:=A) (n:=n) b q) -> eqP A eqA n (Rminus b nZb (minuspf A A0 A1 eqA invA minusA multA eqA_dec n ltM ltM_dec (mults multA (n:=n) b p) (mults multA (n:=n) a q)) (pX (A:=A) (n:=n) b q) (mults multA (n:=n) b p)) (mults multA (n:=n) (invTerm invA (n:=n) (T1 A1 n)) (multpf A A0 eqA plusA multA eqA_dec n ltM ltM_dec (pX (A:=A) (n:=n) a p) q))

Fixpoint spolyf_red3 (A : Set) (A0 A1 : A) (eqA : A -> A -> Prop) (plusA : A -> A -> A) (invA : A -> A) (minusA multA : A -> A -> A) (divA : A -> forall b : A, ~ eqA b A0 -> A) (eqA_dec : forall a b : A, {eqA a b} + {~ eqA a b}) (n : nat) (ltM : mon n -> mon n -> Prop) (ltM_dec : forall a b : mon n, {ltM a b} + {ltM b a} + {a = b}) (Q : list (poly A0 eqA ltM)) (p q : list (Term A n)) : canonical A0 eqA ltM (pX (A:=A) (n:=n) a p) -> canonical A0 eqA ltM (pX (A:=A) (n:=n) b q) -> eqP A eqA n (mults multA (n:=n) (minusTerm minusA (n:=n) a b) p) (minuspf A A0 A1 eqA invA minusA multA eqA_dec n ltM ltM_dec (mults multA (n:=n) a p) (mults multA (n:=n) b p)) ->
canonical A0 eqA ltM (pX (A:=A) (n:=n) (invTerm invA (n:=n) (T1 A1 n)) q).
Proof.
  intros.
  apply H.
Qed.
```
